Starting and Stopping a Server Configuration

Server configurations may need to be started or stopped. For example, new server configurations must be set to run after they have been created, while existing server configurations may need to be shut down for maintenance.

Note: If all the files in a server configuration are in Native-II format, you do not have to shut down the server for backup purposes. If any files are still in Native-I format, however, the server must be shut down.

You can start or stop a server configuration from the Server Administration dialog or from the command line. This procedure describes how to start a server configuration from the Server Administration dialog and how to re-start it.

To start a server configuration:

  1. On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam Server. This action displays the Server Administration dialog.

  2. Select the server configuration to be started from the left pane. If you have not yet logged on, you will be asked to do so.

  3. Click the Start Local Server icon, or select Actions > Start Server. Alternatively, if you want to start the server configuration with different options, click Start With Override. This action displays the Server Options dialog, on which you can make modifications to the selected configuration.

  4. Depending upon the server configuration selected, one of the following events will occur:

    • If the server configuration was created in StarTeam 2005 or a later release or all of its files have been fully converted to a Native-II format, the server begins its startup procedure.

    • If the server configuration has one or more hives defined, but contains files that are still in Native-I format and conversion is turned off, a message box states: "There are files in this server configuration that have not been converted to the Native-II format and conversion is turned off. Would you like conversion turned on?" If you see this message, click Yes or No. The server then continues its startup procedure.

    • If the server configuration has no associated hives (that is, it is totally in Native-I format), a message box states: "This server configuration has not been converted to the Native-II format. If you start the server now, a default hive will be created because all new files must be placed in a Native-II vault hive. Click OK to start the server (and use a default hive) or click Cancel to create your own hive using the Hive Manager." If you see this message, click OK to create the default hive and continue the startup procedure or Cancel to exit and display the Server Tools dialog, from which you can access the Hive Manager and create a new hive. You can then return to the Server Tools dialog and start the server configuration.

    After the server configuration completes its startup procedure, its Status changes to Running.

To shut down a server configuration:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    These actions display the Server Administration dialog.

  2. Select the server configuration to be shut down from the left pane. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only. If you have not yet logged in, you will be asked to do so.

  3. Click the Shut Down Local Server icon, or select Actions > Shut down Server.

      4. The system asks you to confirm the shutdown.

  4. Click OK.
